comment.author: 8161633@N02
comment._content: Typical male sculptor...sees the wife as a Lilliputian...Just wait till the female sculptors take over...hmmm...does that sound catty? Maybe the sculptor was just depicting the way things were, without comment...is that the same thing? Am I just repeating myself? Joan Rivers said that when she was at a bar recently an older man approached & this was his opening line " So...Do I come here often ? " ...

comment.author: 10647023@N04
comment._content: Of course you all realize this is all symbolic. The king is Ramses II and that's one of his daughters, whom he prob. married anyway.

comment.author: 18258780@N00
comment._content: The woman is his wife Nefertari

comment.author: 10647023@N04
comment._content: If that is Nefertari, it one of the rare times that she isn't made of the same proportions as he. I'm still not convinced it is she.
